lines.text: How do you spell Mississippi?
M-I-S-S-I... Who cares, mom? I live in Maine!
I know you're sad, you miss your mom. But please don't die, I'll be your best friend forever. And I will always take care of you, I promise. I love you.

[about Billy Baker]
Careful, Harry! He's mad as a hornet and drunk as skunk!
My favorite combination.
Harry, why is there herring in the fridge?
It's for a friend.
A fish eating raspberry blowing friend? Harry Whitney, you KNEW that seal was gonna come back here!

[hears Steve and Paula arguing]
Jeez, Harry. I don't know why you're so interested in critters. You got yourself a whole pack of wild ones at home.
What do you think went wrong with him and her?
Maybe him and her ain't a him and her.

[shocked]
I put the dress on the wrong one?
[last lines]

[voice over narration]
Many years ago, a seal named Andre made his first historic swim home and his life became legend. Every winter he lived the life of a gentlemen at the country aquarium. Every Spring my Dad set him free, and every time Andre made the two hundred and fifty mile journey home to spend the Summer with us, his family. By the time Andre was twenty four years old, he could hardly see. But that didn't stop him from completing his final trip. In all the journeys since my youth, and on all the journeys I have ahead of me, I know I'll never find a better friend than Andre.
By the time Andre was twenty four years old, he could hardly see. But that didn't stop him from completing his final trip.
He's not prejudiced, you know. He hates everybody.
What a surprise to see you hear at mealtime.
Billy, we grew up together!
I didn't like you then either!
We get it. We got it the first time. We got it the last forty-seven times. It ain't funny.
[Paula is listening to the song "Johnny Angel" when Steve enters her bedroom]
What are you talking about?
Eighty-seven!
[Steve opens the bedroom window and takes Paula's record off the spindle]
Hey!
You played this song 87 times and I can't stand it anymore!
[Steve throws the record out the window like a frisbee; Paula tries to get it back, but she's still wearing her hairdryer]
Mom, Steve took my record!
[Paula's record lands in the backyard where Toni, Grief and Harry are chopping wood]
All right, you two, knock it off!
You're driving me crazy, Paula!
[Thalice, Paula and Steve continue to argue]

[to Harry; about his family fighting]
Gee, Harry. I can't figure out why you're so interested in critters when you've got yourself a whole pack of wild ones at home.
[Andre and Steve are eating popcorn and watching TV together]
I'm sick of this. Let's watch a game.
[Andre objects Steve's decision by blowing a raspberry]
Okay, this is good.

[enters the barn while Paula and Mark are smoking]
What the hell are you two doing?

[as she and Mark hide their cigarettes]
Nothing, Dad.
Give it here! Give it here!
[hands her father the cigarette and he puts it out]
That's it, Paula! You're grounded for a week and you get out of here now! I don't want to see you back here ever!
Look, Mr. Whitney, I'm sorry.
You're sorry all right and you're not fit to be around my daughter.
Oh yeah? Well, my dad says... He says you're not fit to be harbor master.
What?
He also says that... that you're a big jerk!
[storms out of the barn]
You stay away from him, Paula. I mean it.

[also storms out of the barn]
You don't even know him!
Oh yeah? Like father like son.

[follows Paula as she runs upstairs and starts packing her things]
Oh dear!
Dad is so unfair! He doesn't care about me!

[helps her pack]
Of course he does. He loves you very much. It's just one of his ways of showing it. You know when you were born he wanted to take front page ad out in the newspaper. I'm not kidding. And he was so mad that the 11th paged all the other birth announcements. Oh, Paula, he so friendly and he still is.
No, he's not! He doesn't care at all and I don't know why you always stand up for him! I hate him! I hate him!
Don't you ever ever say that about your father again! Do you hear me, young lady?
[starts crying and Thalice hugs her]
